title: The Future of Healthcare is Today: How Prepared are Organizations to Leverage Big Data?
text:
Submitted by admin on 10/12/2015 @ 7:31 AM Companies mentioned in this article: Frost & Sullivan 
MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., Oct. 12, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- WHEN: 11:00 a.m. EDT on Thursday, October 15, 2015 LOCATION: Online, with free registration (Email kayla.belcher@frost.com) EXPERT PANELIST: Frost & Sullivan Global Program Director of Visionary Healthcare, Venkat Rajan; Manager of BI and Data Warehousing for Children's Healthcare of Atlanta, Tod Davis; Principal Solutions Architect for Cloudera, Amandeep Khurana; Lead Solutions Architect for Intel Health & Life Sciences, Chris Gough 
Photo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20151012/276000 
This webinar is the first of a three part web series exploring how healthcare information is being transformed into impactful insights through Big Data solutions. The vast solution spectrum for analytics can often be daunting to care providers trying to identify how to prioritize strategies, given the unique needs of their institution. 
Join this webinar to learn more about enabling best practices applications such as: -- Predictive analytics -- Data modeling for informing new research -- Error mitigation/prevention -- Improved patient outcomes -- Efficiencies in resource management 
Hear unique perspectives from clinical and industry experts on how Big Data solutions are being used today by healthcare institutions. Experts explore how forward-thinking healthcare organizations can use analytics to optimize care delivery. 
Attend this webinar to discover: -- How Hadoop is being employed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta -- Use cases employing big data analytics across the entire healthcare value chain -- How organizations can start deriving value from data -- The scale and timeframes for realistic ROI -- Perspectives on how institutions are looking to analytics to support future initiatives 
The webinar series is essential for senior executives throughout healthcare organizations (Chief Executive Officers, Chief Medical Officers, Chief Information Officers, Chief Security Officers and Chief Financial Officers) looking to understand the role that data analytics will play in their future success.
